definition[0]: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office
example[0]: a clerk in a commercial firm
definition[1]: someone whose job is to help people in a shop
example[1]: the clerk in the shoe store
definition[2]: someone whose job is to help people when they arrive at and leave a hotel
example[2]: Leave the keys with the desk clerk.
definition[3]: an official in charge of the records of a court, town council etc
definition[4]: a priest in the Church of England
example[4]: Plans of the land were deposited with the clerk of the county council.
definition[6]: someone who deals with people arriving in a hotel
